Hall 14.title: 42birds
Hall 14.description: We'll do some Yoga to calm our minds and move them bodies!

Hall A.title: About
Hall A.subtitle: Talk & Discussion
Hall A.description:
Wie eine Gruppe ganz normaler Leute gegen den NSA-Skandal ankämpft:
Wir hacken Politik und Gesellschaft. Gespräch für Gespräch und Aufkleber für Aufkleber.

Hall 13.title: Ai Weiwei is Living in Our Future
Hall 13.description: Starting with Ai Wei Wei, this talk will explore the societal consequences of ubiquitous surveillance. Who is watching who? How does it feel to be a watcher? Does first-person recording change our perspective of the world? Can we escape looking at each other?

Hall 13.title: Alternative Learning Tank
Hall 13.subtitle: Taking the crypto-pitchfork out of the squares and the hackerspaces and into the institutions
Hall 13.description: The Alternative Learning Tank is a nomadic school and artistic organization that focuses in the research, creation and implementation of educational programs on progressive and radical fields of knowledge that are not contemplated by educational institutions. It strives for a reform of those institutions, embracing how knowledge is being produced and transferred in the XXI century. Drawing from precedents such as contemporary social movements, digital rights, hacker culture, new media and a general critical stand point about technology. ALT develops a practice of intellectual production and advocacy at the intersection between pedagogy, art and activism.

Hall 13.title: Brewing with probiotic biofilm polycutures - Advanced
Hall 13.description: We will discuss probiotic drink brewing in more depth sharing our experience and oing variety of tasting.

Hall 13.title: Morning Tea with RIPE NCC
Hall 13.subtitle:
Tuesday Morning: (Day 4)  IPv4 Hijacking

In the previous few years, number of IPv4 hijack cases increased, since IPv4 addresses have higher economic value due to IPv4 scarcity. Curious how does RIEP NCC deals with this, and what do we do to prevent it? 

http://www.ripe.net/internet-coordination/press-centre/publications/presentations/2014/ipv4-hijacking-our-experience
Hall 13.description: 3 mornings about RIPE / NCC topics: RIPE Atlas, Internet Governance and IPv4 Hijacks. 11AM, Room 13, Tea!!!

Hall 13.title: OONI
Hall 13.subtitle: Adopt an ooniprobe
Hall 13.description: Internet censorship measurement and how you can help to make a difference!

Hall 15.title: Start to knit!
Hall 15.subtitle: Yarn and needles for free
Hall 15.description:
For all who couldn't attend the first workshop, and refreshers!

We’re going to go through the process of knitting the knit stitch and the purl stitch step by step, and we’ll also cover things you need to know before you start knitting, and several important techniques (such as how to start your knitting and how to end it!).

Hall 15.description:

Hall C.subtitle: maybe extra Session - watch for updates

Hall C.title: "How to survive 31c3" CryptoParty
Hall C.description: A network full of hackers can be quite intimidating. We want to address all the questions many of the new visitors might have or regulars might be too afraid to ask by now. And if not all of them then the most urgent ones. The ones that keep your password from being projected onto a wall screen.

Hall C.title: 42birds
Hall C.description: Do you want to meet new people? Join us at speed dating for geeks!

Hall C.title: Mobile Self-Defense
Hall C.subtitle: Detecting Intercept and Tracking attacks on Android phones.

Hall 15.title: Breaking Bad Crypto
Hall 15.description:
Are you a programmer? Do you want to learn cryptography? Well the best way to do it is by breaking some!

We will walk through some badly implemented piece of cryptography and tear it apart together.

BRING YOUR LAPTOP

Hall 15.title: Contributing to Tails by working on Debian
Hall 15.description: sometimes, the best way to help Tails is to make Debian better; let's see how

Hall 15.title: Improving the infrastructure behind Tails
Hall 15.description: getting started with Tails system administration

Hall 15.title: Translate Tails
Hall 15.description: hands-on translations: how to set up a working environment to improve Tails in your language, it's easier than it sounds.

Hall 14.title: Breaking Bad Crypto
Hall 14.subtitle: Re-run
Hall 14.description:
Are you a programmer? Do you want to learn cryptography? Well the best way to do it is by breaking some!

We will walk through some badly implemented piece of cryptography and tear it apart together.

BRING YOUR LAPTOP

Hall 14.title: Crocheting Hyperboles
Hall 14.subtitle: Crocheting the CCC Reef
Hall 14.description:
Only in the 19th century the formal study of non-Euclidean geometry started and was not able to construct physical models.
But yes: we can. We will crochet various hyperbolic planes as we found them in nature. Colored and beautiful.
Use it as yarnbombs for Guerilla Knitting, decoration, space models, keyrings and many other things.

Hall 14.title: No, Mister Bond. I expect you to die. - Newton's Laws in a rotating System
Hall 14.description:
en: Not strapped to a centrifuge I'm able to construct Newton's (third) law in a rotating system.
And then you'll know why the centrifugal force is a REAL force!

de: Ich zeige, dass die Zentrifugalkraft sehr wohl eine reale Kraft ist. Es kommt nur drauf an, in welchem Referenzsystem man sich befindet.

Hall 14.title: Queer Feminist Geek Gathering
Hall 14.subtitle: Second room so we can split up the group if necessary (was necessary at the 30C3, and having only one room was a VERY heavy handicap where half the participants ended up talking outside).
Hall 14.description: A gathering for all the queer feminist geek folk. We will use it mainly for networking, exchanging our projects and ideas, and talk about how to make things better in geek culture for us and others.

Hall 14.title: Umbrella org meetup
Hall 14.description: The "Umbrella" group invites people interested in umbrella organizations (orgs handling multiple projects) to a meetup.

Hall B.title: Guerillaknitting 101 - Lets Yarnbomb 31C3
Hall B.subtitle: presentation and hands-on practice
Hall B.description: This session, which is getting a tradition at XC3, will first give a colorful and practical introduction into the art of guerillaknitting, with many inspiring pictures of global knit hacking examples - by individuals, local and global communities with trees, bridges, tanks, cars, planes, stones or power cords covered in knitting. Attendants will learn the basics of how to yarnbomb the 31C3 (or any other place indoor or outdoor). Bring knitting needles and wool but there will also be some material available (if you want to donate yarn, bring it along or bring it to the T-Shirt Shop). Lets join forces to beautify the congress centre! This time, I suggest we use the colour code of the 31C3 for yarnbombing (see long description for details on colours and measures).

Hall B.title: WeFixTheNet
Hall B.subtitle: Welcome (Introduction)
Hall B.description: The "We Fix the Net" assembly" is to be the perfect place at 31c3 for all hackers to do something about replacing today's broken Internet with secure alternatives. We hope to have some talks and panels like last year.

Hall B.title: WeFixTheNet
Hall B.subtitle: Bernd Paysan: "net2o - reinventing the Internet: lightweight, scalable and userfriendly" (Introduction)
Hall B.description: The "We Fix the Net" assembly" is to be the perfect place at 31c3 for all hackers to do something about replacing today's broken Internet with secure alternatives. We hope to have some talks and panels like last year.

Hall 13.title: OKFN Open Science Meeting
Hall 13.description: Meeting of the OKFN Open Science workgroup and anybody interested in Open Science.

Hall 13.title: OONI
Hall 13.subtitle: Open Observatory of Network Interference
Hall 13.description: Internet censorship measurement and how you can help to make a difference!

Hall 13.title: Queer Feminist Geek Gathering
Hall 13.description: A gathering for all the queer feminist geek folk. We will use it mainly for networking, exchanging our projects and ideas, and talk about how to make things better in geek culture for us and others.

Hall 13.title: Vorstellung des Freifunk Forums
Hall 13.description:
Im Westen hat sich innerhalb von ein paar Monaten ein gemeinsames Forum etabliert, in dem bereits über 4000 Beiträge geschrieben worden. Mit der Software Discourse haben wir eine Lösung gefunden, die die Kommunikation der vereinzelten Communities stark verbessert hat. Lebhafter Austausch durch einfache Bedienbarkeit und Moderation durch ein Team von Engagierten können der gesamten Freifunk-Community helfen.

Zunächst wird die Funktion der Software vorgeführt und die wichtigsten Vorteile gegenüber Mailinglisten dargestellt. Außerdem gibt es einen Einblick in die Erfahrungen, die wir beim Betrieb des Forums gemacht haben. Der Vortrag dient auch als Input zur einer Diskussion, ob das Newsgroups und Mailinglisten langfristig abgelöst werden können.

Hall 14.title: 42birds
Hall 14.description: We'll do some Yoga to calm our minds and move them bodies!

Hall 14.title: Ein Bündnis gegen Überwachung schmieden - Forging an alliance against mass surveillance
Hall 14.description:
Wir möchten die diesjährige Diskussion über ein "Bündnis gegen Überwachung" mit Euch fortführen.

We want to continue this year's discussion about an "alliance against mass surveillance".

Hall 14.title: Hillhacks
Hall 14.description: Vereinsgründung (founding of a german NGO), everyone is invited, "Hackers without Borders", to support hackers and makers in India for conducting hillhacks, in the Himalaya, and seahacks (s'hacks) in Kerala at the sea: both events made for hackers by hackers, very much inspired by the C3 approach, but also very much focused on empowerment for the local people. With that general name it can be used for various other things in the future, too. Pls be part! :)

Hall 14.title: Kreative Steganografie
Hall 14.description: Steganografie, was ist das, etwas mit Grafik? Nein, es ist Spaß am Zweckentfremden von Datenformaten und Dingen. Lasst euch klassische sowie ausgefallene Stego-Methoden anfängertauglich erklären und entwickelt eigene Ideen.

Hall 14.title: Multimeter Calibration Party
Hall 14.description: This workshop is intented for people who want to make sure their multimeters are still within spec. I bring the tools to calibrate and adjust your multimeter.

Hall 15.title: Adopt your MEP
Hall 15.subtitle: Brainstorm
Hall 15.description:
As less and less legislation is coming from national governments and more and more policies are being decided by the EU, we need to take democratic participation to a whole new level. ACTA, net neutrality, surveillance measures - these and many other topics are decided in Brussels. We might not have the same resources as industry lobbyists, but we have the tools!

So how should an independent and non-partisan platform look like that could help us enter into a dialogue with our elected representatives? Memopol, PiPhone and Parltrack made a great start, join us for a brainstorming session on how to improve our tools for political engagement. Our goal is that all of us can take away experience on how to contact your MEPs and to share ideas for new tools

Hall 15.title: Arch Linux Workshop
Hall 15.description: A workshop focusing on all aspects of Arch Linux: installation, maintenance, exchange of ideas and experiences, advanced techniques and tips. Open to everyone. Might turn into a mass install party of Arch.

Hall 15.title: Digital Radio Broadcasting
Hall 15.description: DAB+ Digital Radio Broadcasting using SDR and free open source tools ODR-mmbtools.

Hall 15.title: EU surveillance
Hall 15.description: The EU is planning to introduce a EU-wide retention system of your flight travel data. This session discusses why this is a bad idea and how we can stop it.

Hall 15.title: Hillhacks
Hall 15.subtitle: a documentary
Hall 15.description:
hillhacks is an event around hacking and making in Dharamshala, India, in the foothills of the Himalaya. It took place for the first time in October 2014: Two Weeks of Workshops with locals and kids, and 4 days of conference with the experts from India, Nepal and all around the world. Next edition will be 23th May till 7th June in 2015. 

This is a documentary movie showing what we've done.

Hall 15.title: Meeting of CryptoParty organizers
Hall 15.description: CryptoParty is a decentralized, selforganized, global movement. This means it's easy to lose touch. We want to change that a bit – at least for organizers of CryptoParties who attend 31c3. Let's meet and see where we go from there.

Hall 15.title: PLux, DG13, Directives and Regulations (aka how the EU works)
Hall 15.subtitle: How the EU works
Hall 15.description: Why is PLux so important? What the hell is DG13? How do EU institutions work and why should we get involved in policy making?

Hall 15.title: Storm and privateers ahead on the cybersea
Hall 15.description: A (nautical) discussion on data flow and trade agreements.

Lounge.subtitle: dj-set
Lounge.description: Alec Empire ist Frontmann der Gruppe Atari Teenage Riot und Gründer der Label Digital Hardcore Recordings.

Lounge.title: Blackberry Fields
Lounge.subtitle: live!
Lounge.description: Blackberry Fields is a Project. A Project by former members of „Woodrow Wilson“. It’s an experience to listen to the sound fields, that the three guys try to raise. Based on psychedelic, experimental rock and beat of the late 60s & 70s, many other musical influences are present in the concept.

Für euch abgesandt wurde Flotze 2.0 welcher im Zeichen des Technoiden - von hypnotischem Detroit und Dub- bis zu industriell,verschobenem Distortion Techno, das Publikum grenzüberschreitend an die Schwelle zur Transzendenz begleitet.

Lounge.title: Gammler und Kundan Lal

Lounge.title: Herr Schmidt
Lounge.subtitle: dj-set
Lounge.description: Sir Raetz, Flotze 2.0, Maus, Herr Schmidt und Le Bouf, auch unter dem Synonym Ravebotta bekannt. Herr Schmidt kommt tief unter die Gürtellinie. Sein Sound lässt nach unten keinen Spielraum: Bässer kann Musik nicht klatschen. Der trockene, minimale, bisweilen auch harte Sound ist ein Klang- und Druckerlebnis, das an Qualität nicht missen lässt.

Hall 13.title: Angewandte Konsensdemokratie
Hall 13.description: In diesem Workshop kann geübt werden, wie Entscheidungen im Konsensverfahren funktionieren. Damit können u.a. Hackerspaces (imho) klügere, sozialere und stabilere Entscheidungen treffen, als das ein Vereinsvorstand alleine könnte. Ich hab den workshop schon in ein paar Chaosnahen Rahmen gemacht, den Leuten gefiels (haben sie zumindest behauptet :-). Detaillierte Beschreibung der Inhalte hinter dem Link. Kommt alle!

Hall 13.title: Building an anycast VPN
Hall 13.description: Discussion session about building an anycast-based VPN service on the Internet, for resilience, scalability, and fun.

Hall 13.title: Freifunk
Hall 13.description: A workshop for peering between Freifunk communities and the big internet.

Hall 13.title: How Freifunk Rheinland became an ISP
Hall 13.description: We are a Local Internet Registrar, member of RIPE. We are one of the very few community LIRs.What does it mean "Autonomous System"? How the Rheinland Backbone technically works? What about Rheinland Backbone Policy? Q&A about our Usage Policy. We offer default routing for your Freifunk Community! Fibre to the Roof!

Hall 13.title: Messaging
Hall 13.description: Technical workshop for those involved in building and maintaining secure messaging systems - such as OTR, Pond, and various group chat protocols. We'll begin by reporting on progress in the last year, then split up into per-topic discussion groups.

Hall 13.title: Morning Tea with RIPE NCC
Hall 13.subtitle:
Sunday Morning: (Day 2) Meetup with RIPE Atlas community -- For RIPE Atlas users old and new, experts and newbies, ambassadors and developers; presenting new features; listening to feature requests.

Organised by the Community Builder for Measurements Tools, Vesna Manojlovic

There will be tea!

Previous events: https://wiki.techinc.nl/index.php/RIPE_Atlas_probes_at_hackerspaces
Hall 13.description: 3 mornings about RIPE / NCC topics: RIPE Atlas, Internet Governance and IPv4 Hijacks. 11AM, Room 13, Tea!!!

Hall 13.title: SDR for noobs
Hall 13.description:
Get started with some simple Software Defined Radio.

Please install GnuRadio. No hardware required, we will provide files with captured data.

Hall A.title: Anonymes Handy, anonyme Kreditkarte
Hall A.subtitle: Talk & Discussion
Hall A.description:
Sowohl Mobilfunk- als auch Kreditkarten werden in DE nur nach Identitätsprüfung abgegeben bzw. aktiviert.
Damit ist es nicht ganz so einfach, bei $Transaktionen im Internet Anonymität zu wahren.
Ich zeige in dieser Session, wie sich jeder mit überschaubarem Aufwand ein anonymes Prepaid-Handy und eine anonyme Prepaid-Kreditkarte zulegen kann.

Hall A.title: C3S
Hall A.description: Die Cultural Commons Collecting Society (C3S) arbeitet seit 2010 darauf hin, offiziell als alternative Verwertungsgesellschaft für Musik anerkannt zu werden. Wir fassen in dieser Session zusammen, was dabei 2014 alles passiert ist, und wollen auch vorstellen, wie man uns bei der Softwareentwicklung konkret weiterhelfen kann.

Hall A.title: Freifunk
Hall A.description: A workshop for peering between Freifunk communities and the big internet.

Hall A.title: KinkyGeeks - How To Play "Safe"
Hall A.description: Eine einführende Erklärung wie man verschiedene BDSM-Spielarten sicher ausüben kann.

Hall A.title: Sensing proximity
Hall A.description:
Presenting our app nervousnet, that will provide an experimental indoor navigation at CCH and also build a social graph of people using the app and detected transmitter beacons. We will also give away some free beacons, so that people can participate without the app.

Our long-term project, nervous, aims to enable scientific research for the public good — by transparently collating data from mobile devices, sensors and social media.

_Planned time: Day 2, 16.00-17.00_

Hall C.description: Regional meeting of the Chaos Computer Club. Not intended for the general public but not top secret either. If you don't know what this is, you should probably not go there.

Hall 15.title: Parliamentary Inquiry on Mass Surveillance in Germany
Hall 15.subtitle: A little talk with a lot of discussion
Hall 15.description: What is happening in the parliamentary investigation in Germany, how does it work, what has been achieved so far and will there be asylum for Snowden in Berlin? What's the point and the purpose to do this work in parliament? I'd also like to discuss what is happening along these lines in other countries.

Hall 15.title: The Surveillance State
Hall 15.description: Undercover Police officers in the UK spent years living with activists, forming the most intimate relationships and infiltrating every single part of our lives. No matter how many layers of encryption you use, if your closest companions are cops, sharing your home, your details and your computer, there is nowhere to hide. This talk is by one of a group of 8 women suing the London Metropolitan Police over undercover abuses. It will look at the experience of police infiltration in the UK, some of our responses, and how that might relate to digital privacy struggles and resistance to other parts of the surveillance state.

Lounge.title: After Thunderstrike
Lounge.description: After the Thunderstrike EFI firmware bootkit talk, we'll walk through some of the more technical parts of the boot process, the vulnerability and protection.

Lounge.title: At tHe SpAcE oFFiCe
Lounge.subtitle: live!
Lounge.description: ElectroBeats treffen hier auf verstörte StopMotion Filme und verschmelzen mit geschmackvoll-abgedrehten Gitarren- & Sythesizerklängen zu einer mitreißenden Geschichte. Als fester Bestandteil der Chaos Computer Kultur erschließen At The Space Office neue Welten aus chaotischer Improvisation und frischer, verspielter Eingängigkeit.

Lounge.title: Bimmel
Lounge.subtitle: dj-set
Lounge.description: DJ-Set

Lounge.title: Shétsou
Lounge.subtitle: live!
Lounge.description: Shétsou sind ein hamburger Trio bestehend aus Keys+Vocals, E-Bass und Drums. Musikalisch bewegen sie sich irgendwo zwischen den Grenzen von Jazzfusion und smoothem TripHop zum Wegträumen. Urban, feurig, chillig, bewegend.

Lounge.title: Skinnerbox
Lounge.subtitle: live!
Lounge.description: Skinnerbox have positioned themselves well above the inflationary electronic scene hailing from Berlin. Skinnerbox are also the makers of the "sbx 2049", a virtual drum machine software, officially released by “Ableton” and thus are the first artists to release their own self made - branded “Ableton” live instrument.

Lounge.title: Zeitgeist
Lounge.subtitle: dj-set
Lounge.description: Dubstep DJ-Set

Hall 13.title: CameoNet for Crypto Angles
Hall 13.description:
We want to present the open multi platform encrypted messenger cameoNet to more Crypto Angels. cameoNet is a new project located in Germany that offers more than end-to-end encryption and has been presented already several times at Cryptoparties in Berlin. 
We offer a brief introduction and would like to get your feedback! 

This session is for Angels who usually explain IM/Jabber/OTR, and all the others ...

Hall 13.title: DO! NOT! TRACK!
Hall 13.description:
Einstellung des Browsers Firefox, um die Datenspur beim Surfen zu reduzieren. Massnahmen gegen kommerzielle Überwachung. 
----
Setup for the browser Firefox to reduce the datatrace during surfing the web. Measures against commercial surveillance.

Hall 13.title: Erfa-VOC meeting
Hall 13.description: How we may stream and record Chaos-Events at Erfa locations

Hall 13.title: GnuPG in use with smart cards
Hall 13.description: Werner Koch is the main developer of GnuPG. He ist hosting a session about the use of GnuPG encryption with a smart card and (FSFE Fellowship card) and a card reader. Pros and Cons and Howto of encryption with a physical card

Hall 13.title: Improving Anonymity in Bitcoin with CoinShuffle
Hall 13.description:
Bitcoin's use of pseudonyms (Bitcoin addresses) towards protecting users' privacy has been an attractive feature to many of its adopters. However, due to the inherent public nature of the Bitcoin transaction ledger (the blockchain), Bitcoin does not provide real anonymity in fact. 
I will present why and how Bitcoin users can be deanonymized. Then I will explain the CoinShuffle protocol, a completely decentralized Bitcoin mixing protocol that allows users to utilize Bitcoin in a truly anonymous manner. The key feature of CoinShuffle is that it is deployable immediately without changing the Bitcoin protocol. Since the protocol introduces only a small computation and communication overhead for its users, it is ready for practical deployment, and several implementations are under way.

Hall 13.title: LEAP Provider Hands-On
Hall 13.subtitle: Hands-On
Hall 13.description: Hands-on: Setting up a leap provider (vpn, email or both) from scratch.

Hall 13.title: Morning Tea with RIPE NCC
Hall 13.subtitle:
Monday Morning: (Day 3) Internet Governance 

RIPE NCC is participating in "IANA transition" process, the hottest Internet Governance topic this & next year. What's new? What's your input? 

Previously on this topic: https://wiki.techinc.nl/index.php/Internet_Governance_and_hackers
Hall 13.description: 3 mornings about RIPE / NCC topics: RIPE Atlas, Internet Governance and IPv4 Hijacks. 11AM, Room 13, Tea!!!

Hall 13.title: Retro Demo Coding
Hall 13.subtitle: Your own Atari 2600 VCS demo in just three hours
Hall 13.description: You learn something new every day, how about learning something retro? Like coding a demo for a game console that was created in the late 70's. The Atari 2600 VCS provides 128 bytes of RAM, an address space for 4k of ROM and NO framebuffer.

Hall 13.title: Secure your Android 2nd time
Hall 13.description: Due to the interest, we have our workshop a 2nd time: You can turn your standard Android phone into a device which gives you significant more control over our data. It just needs a little bit of love and sacrifice.

Hall 13.title: U.S. and International Anti-Surveillance Activism
Hall 13.description: Discussion about how anti-surveillance activists in the US and Europe can share knowledge and work together.

Hall 13.title: What's next in the world of designing much needed secure protocols?
Hall 13.description: Brainstorm session about secure `binary reproducibility and verification protocol` protocols. How can we better protect users, leak less metadata and create a more pleasant experience? This workshop will focus on making a design for reproducible builds, what do tools lack for the moment? How can we improve those tools? However, users are not going to compile our software they download the binaries, how can they verify it isn't tampered with? I have a sketch laying in my drawer for months now that I feel should be refined for great benefit of users world wide.

Hall 13.title: Wikidata
Hall 13.description: Have you heard of the biggest new project around Wikipedia already? Structured data to hack cool stuff? It's called Wikidata. Meet the people who make it happen.

Hall 14.title: Crying on the bathroom floor for no apparent reason.
Hall 14.description: Your psychologist most likely is on vacation, so this is to be a spot to talk about depression, to share your experience.

Hall 14.title: Freifunk
Hall 14.description: Best practices for communities, i.e., political strategies, funding, ...

Hall 14.title: Haecksen Frühstück/Breakfast
Hall 14.description:
Very spontaneous breakfast for female hackers in the tradition of previous congresses, but not organized by the same people. Not organized at all, actually ;-)

Let's meet, exchange, create a network.  Bring some food, dishes, coffee-making-equipment - we have nothing yet!

This meeting is female-only, whatever "female" means for you.  Lurkers, Friends and Allies: sorry, this one not for you.

Hall 14.title: The DCP Bay
Hall 14.description: The DCP Bay is a concrete example of what people can do with free software and community-driven Internet infrastructure: providing an alternative scheme for digital movie transport, from the distributors to the theaters.

Hall 14.title: Verbesserung der Zusammenarbeit gegen Massenüberwachung - Improving inter-organizational work on mass surveillance

Hall A.title: DIY ISP meetup
Hall A.description: DIY Internet service providers exist all around the world: come and share your experiences with other DIY ISPs!  There was a similar meetup last year at 30C3; we will discuss what we have achieved since then, and how the future looks like for DIY ISPs.

Hall A.title: Fotopia's engine room
Hall A.subtitle: Questions & Working-on-it
Hall A.description:
During our Workshop we will do the following:
* having room for detailed questions regarding our concept/idea
* highlight (software-)problems
* agree on communication channels & coding framework (Ruby-on-Rails?!)
* set up a github for start coding
* (make up an agenda)
* share a lot of enthusiasm

Hall A.title: Freifunk Webteam Meetup
Hall A.subtitle: Gemeinsam mit media.freifunk.net
Hall A.description:
Freifunk Webteam Meetup (Andi, Monic)
   Neue Dienste besprechen
   - forum.freifunk.net
   - media.freifunk.net 
   - kalender.freifunk.net
   - timeline.freifunk.net
   Todos updaten :)

Hall A.title: How to throw a CryptoParty
Hall A.description:
You attended the "How to survive 31c3" CryptoParty and now want to organize your own? You know how to crypto but not to party? You know how to party but not to crypto?

Learn to teach. Teach to learn.

Hall A.title: SBH
Hall A.description:
Die Schwarzbeutelherausforderung.

Ein Lockpicking-Geschicklichkeits-Spiel.

6 Teams von 1-3 Leuten bekommen einen "schwarzen Beutel" mit Werkzeugen gestellt, und brechen mit hilfe dieser unter Zeitdruck in ein simuliertes Zimmer ein. Dort müssen verschiedene Informationen gesammelt, und weitere Aufgaben erledigt werden, und das Zimmer vor Ablauf der Zeit wieder ordentlich verlassen werden.

Das schnellste Team mit den meisten gelösten Aufgaben gewinnt.

Nur leichte Vorkenntnisse nötig.

Noch werden Teams gesucht, Voranmeldung per E-Mail an <sec@42.org>

Hall A.title: SIP und so
Hall A.subtitle: Talk & Discussion
Hall A.description:
Wir haben uns daran gewöhnt, dass wir mit unseren Handys jederzeit und überall erreichbar sind.
Leider geben wir dafür auch jederzeit preis, wo wir uns gerade aufhalten.
Ich zeige mehrere Ansätze, mit der jeder diese Kopplung zwischen Mobilkommunikation und Ortung aufbrechen kann.

Hall B.title: EU Copyright Reform
Hall B.description: Workshop to follow the "Correcting copywrongs: European copyright reform is finally on the horizon" session

Hall B.title: Framing Data Retention
Hall B.description: Data retention was killed decisively by the European Court earlier this year. It's dead - but it's also still moving. It's a ZOMBIE LAW (cue the scary music). We need to design new ways to combat the undead. And we know that new zombie eggs are being hatched as we speak. How to fight those? In our time together we will explore ways to win the fight. By framing the discussion in the most effective way.

Hall B.title: TTIP & CETA - let's troll it!
Hall B.description: Workshop on how to troll two of the biggest threats to democracy and the rule of law, disguised as free trade agreements. 2015 will be the year of non/ratification and negotiation of two EU deals that could end western democracy as we know it. Let's try to analyse pro TTIP and pro CETA propaganda and gather best counter-arguments.

Hall B.title: Whisky
Hall B.description: This is the fourth incarnation of the popular whisky evening. It's fairly simple: If you enjoy good whisky with nice people, or are planing to do so, join us. We'll have the virtual chimney fire going.

Hall C.title: Mappen mit OpenStreetMap für Einsteiger
Hall C.description: In diesem Hands-On zeigen ich euch, wie man mit dem Online-Editor iD und dem Offline-Editor JOSM zu OpenStreetMap beiträgt.

Hall C.title: SDR for noobs
Hall C.subtitle: Depending on how much participation we can expect after the first workshop on Day 2, we might or might not do this second session.
Hall C.description:
Get started with some simple Software Defined Radio.

Please install GnuRadio. No hardware required, we will provide files with captured data.

Hall C.title: Tamagotchi Hackers Unite!
Hall C.description: Didn't get enough Tamagotchi Hacking at 31c3? Here's your chance to get your fix!

Hall C.title: Verarbeitung von OpenStreetMap-Daten
Hall C.description: In diesem Hands-on zeige ich euch, wie man OpenStreetMap-Daten verarbeitet – Overpass-API, Overpass-Turbo, Imposm, Postgres+PostGIS

Hall C.title: WeFixTheNet
Hall C.subtitle: ITN (invitation only)
Hall C.description: The "We Fix the Net" assembly" is to be the perfect place at 31c3 for all hackers to do something about replacing today's broken Internet with secure alternatives. We hope to have some talks and panels like last year.
